result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason T. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Conversation on how to proceed.  Defense just rec'd the restitution request dated from 2014.  
Parties review the restitution request. 

Sarah Gardner  duly sworn and testifies. Take a break to complete the 3:30 back on the record at 3:55 pm.  

Court orders:
24 months probation w/held
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Undergo Domestic Abuse Intake. Treatment if necessary
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
no contact w/SG except for child placement
Restitution in the amount of $1,745.92 payable to $559.72  Hospital bill, EMS $852.20 and $120 - Door nothing for the cleaning bill. $208 of lost wages.
Plea hearing on October 10, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Victim is not happy with the agreement.  State would like the court to hear from the victim.  The victim addresses the court.  State informs the court as to what the agreement is at this time.  Court takes a break for all parties to get their paperwork in order.  Victim addresses the court a 9:39am.    State places on the record as to why he has agreed to this offer.  Court hears from the Defense attorney.  State responds to the arguement made by the defense.  Back on the record at 11:02 am.  Court agrees to go along with the amendments to the charges that the State has made.  Court agrees to amend count 2 to disorderly conduct and Count 3 to remove the modifiers.  Deft enters a plea of no contest to Counts 2&3 as amended.    Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court to adjourn the sentencing and restitution hearing to be at a later.  All conditions of the current bond remain in-force.

  Plea hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given at 9:03 am.  Defense - Cont. Motion hearing regarding of Spoilation of Evidence by Law Enforcement.  State informs the court as to what is going on in the case.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Defense addresses the court.  Off the record.  State and Defense talk with the Judge.    Will need one hour and half for the plea and sentencing.  Court security needs to be present at the plea and sentencing.
Motion hearing on July 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference on May 26, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State and Defense meet with the judge in the back.  Case called at 8:47 am.  Appearances given.  Cont Motion hearing from January 27, 2016.  Hearing is for the pictures that were taken and problems w/the data in Tomahawk PD.   Anthony Kline  duly sworn and testifies.  Parties rest at 9:28 am.  Court addresses the parties.  Court feels that there should be transcript of this hearing.  Briefing might need to be completed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:00 am.
in Support of Motion to dismiss and instruction - defense

Attorney James Charles Koppelman appeared on behalf of the deft.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  State is requesting the motion hearing be adjourned due to Officer Kline not available.  Defense does not object.  Court does not want to lose the one half hours that is scheduled for the motion hearing.
for adjournment is granted.  There will be not further adjournments per the court.
#1 (dated 1/27/16 with photos taken by the victims mother in the amount of 33)MOR - for purposes of the hearing.

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given at 10:06 am.  Continuance of a Motion Hearing.  Alice Redmond duly sworn and testifies.  Defense and State approach the bench.  There is still an issue with the photos.  Court would like a copy of the transcript from the previous motion hearing and then schedule oral arguements.  Case law to be to the court before oral arguements.  Anthony Klein duly sworn and testifies.  Court recalls Alice Redmond for more testimony.  Defense objects to the recalling of Ms Redmond do to her being in the courtroom during all the discussions.  Court has Ms Redmond set down with no additional testimony.  Defense is going to order a transcript of the first motion hearing.  Defense to file a MIL to keep out photos taken by the parents.  Clerk to give copies of exhibits 1-7 to Officer Kline.
for dismissal due to destruction of evidence - defense
for dismissal due to destruction of evidence - defense
1-9 exhibits are marked.  8&9 offered and received by the defense  1,3,4 6 & 7 offered and received by the state (8 is a video attached to the back of the file)

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 8:41 am, appearances given.  State advises that Count 3 is charged incorrectly.  Should of been charged out as a misdemeanor battery.  State moves to amend Count 3 the modifers stay on with the amended charge.    Court grants the request.  
Court has a couple other matters that need to be discussed.   Defense feels that there are still missing photos.  Defense feels that evidence was withheld from them.  State addresses the court as to the reports from Dr Sodbury  Court moves to exclude Doctor Sudbury's report.
Jury selection at 10:00 am - 10:02 sidebar - 14 jurors will be used, 10:30 am amended information , 11:36 am when to excused jurors.  The jury clerk addresses the court.  Juror #1788 is having anixety issues.  Will address after lunch.
State addresses the court and there is no picture of the deft knuckles.  All photos in the possession of Tomahawk PD are in.    Issues discussed.  Regarding the photos.  Escorting the victim into the courtroom.  Back at 1:00 pm

Back on the record at 1:10 pm.
Issue regarding the pictures that were given to the defense the morning of trial
Court moves to exclude Dr Sudbury report.  State moves for a continuance.  Court takes a 5 min. break so defense can talk with client.  Back on the record at 2:16 pm.  Defense has talked and want to argue the request the adjournment.  Deft want to go forward.  Victim is in favor of a continuance wants the Doctor's report in.  Court rules to grant the continuance 1 - victim wants the continuance, 2 - defense should of been given the report as requests, 3 - missing photos 4 - photos that were given to the defense today 5- was scheduled for a 2 day trial we have lost a day.  Adjournment is granted.  Jury brought into the court room at 2:33 pm.   Court addresses the jurors.  Court excuses the jury and thanks them for their service.

HEARING:
Court wants to make use of the 2 hours remaining.  The video is to be watched. Anthony Kline  duly sworn and testifies.
Jason T Jones  duly sworn and testifies.  Officer Kline is recalled by the State.  State to reproduce picture given by the victim.  The copies should be to the defense by 4:00 pm on Thursday.

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court by phone with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Victim rights complied with.  Status of case.  No agreement at this time.  Will be a 2 day trial.  Need list of witnesses to all parties.

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given by the state.  The victim is present in court.  Court to give his oral ruling on the motions.

Defense motions - 1. Lien by State of Wi with victim - Court will allow questioning if the victim lied or gave false information to a County/State agency.  No reference to be made regarding a lien.  2. Injunction granted in 14CV121 -Court grants the motion as it has to do with truthfulness or untruthfulness no reference to injuction or restraining order.

State motion:
Impeachment motion - prior actions There are 8 prior convictions - Court grants the motion.

Attorney James C. Koppelman appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deft does not appear attorney is here on behalf of the deft.  State is checking on victim rights.  Victim Witness Coord. appears in court.  Addresses the court.  Court adjourns and will reschedule with the victim can be present.  Oral ruling scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin by phone. Court calls the case at 3:39 pm.  Appearances given.  Sherrie from the DA's appears on behalf of the victim coordinator.  Discovery from the Tomahawk PD was given to the defense on June 1st.  Court questions the parties regarding the adjournment. Kelly Thomsen appears at 4:06 pm and addresses the court.  Court grants the adjournment. Gives reasons for the adjournment to the parties.  Will reschedule as a #1 jury trial. Court directs the clerk to remove the jury trial for 7/6/15.  Reschedule the Jury Trial for 2 days.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:00 am.
for Hearing on Admission of prior convictions for impeachment purposes relative to the defendant - State
in support of motion in limine - defense

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussion on the record as to where we are at on the motion.  Court reviews the brief filed by the defense.  Back on the record.  8:50 am.  Court find his notes from the last hearing.  Court advises the parties of what his notes say.  Deputy Anthony Kline  duly sworn and testifies.  Defense requests any audio/video from the incidence.  Arguements heard from the parties.  Court rules that if the defense sees something on the video that is different from the Deputy testimony the defense will be allowed to bring it back to the court. Back on the record from court review testimony.  Court rules 1st and 2nd interviews was not in-custody and no miranda rights.  3rd intervew was in custody and was given his miranda rights - the motion is denied.

Defendant Jason T. Jones in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion in limine.   State objects to the motion.  States that nothing is being eliminated.  Court reviews old cases of the victim of the old crimes.  Court rules prior conviction evidence are out weighed.(1st part).  Lien filed against victim  State opposes part 2 and would like testimony.  Court would like more documentation on the lien.  Court will allow the 3rd part of the motion regarding the restraining order 

May add a day to the jury trial.
